# Welcome  Creating this from Bookdown to Github {#welcome}
I stumbled on how to do this by going to this [website](https://jules32.github.io/bookdown-tutorial/) and built this out from here.  I am glad that I will be able to work on this.

Who to thank
Tidyverse
Augsburg
students
sources
waterparks
family
kids

Things I've changed:

- Cleaned up the code package to be a little bit more lean.
- Using ggplot for graphing. Not a course in dataviz, but wanted to keep things manageable for students while also showing what to do.
- Use of formula notation `y ~ 1 + x` when doing linear regression and dynamics.  Think that this helps improve things.
- Added a Runge-Kutta solver to the mix.
- More work on numerical parameter estimation (apart from MCMC). Should help streamline focus if you wish to not do MCMC solvers.
- New sections: on stochastic modeling.  Added content to exact solutions (integrating factors)
